job.title: Line Cook - $15.50-$16.00/hr
job.description:
Sal's Gumbo Shack is seeking an experienced Line Cook to join our team. As a Line Cook, you will play a pivotal role in crafting and delivering delicious food to the greater Long Beach community.

Gig Summary:

  • $15.50 - $16/hr

  • Part-Time Line Cook (20-24 hrs weekly)

    Apply if you:

  • Have at least 1 year of relevant experience in a fast-paced kitchen environment

  • Have availability for evenings and weekends

What will you do?:

  • Prepare ingredients and follow Sal's Gumbo Shack's signature recipes to create our renowned gumbo and other delectable dishes meticulously

  • Set up workstations with precision, ensuring all necessary ingredients, utensils, and equipment are readily available

  • Cook and present food in a timely manner, upholding Sal's Gumbo Shack's high quality and presentation standards

  • Collaborate seamlessly with the kitchen team to maintain the efficient flow of operations

  • Adhere rigorously to food safety and sanitation guidelines, guaranteeing a clean and organized work area

  • Monitor food inventory levels and actively contribute to inventory management

  • Assist in receiving, storing, and rotating ingredients and supplies to maintain freshness

  • Follow instructions from our esteemed Chefs, adapting recipes and techniques as needed

  • Contribute to the development of new menu items that reflect Sal's Gumbo Shack's culinary philosophy

  • Maintain a positive and professional attitude, thriving under pressure and fostering teamwork

  • Exhibit excellent time management skills, ensuring all orders are promptly completed

  • Take ownership of the cleanliness and maintenance of kitchen equipment, ensuring its

    optimal performance

  • Continuously enhance culinary skills and knowledge through training and professional

    development opportunities

Job requirements:

  • Strong understanding of food preparation techniques, culinary terminology, and operation of kitchen equipment

  • Proficiency in various cooking methods, such as slow cooking, stewing, and simmering, to achieve rich flavors

  • Familiarity with stringent food safety and sanitation regulations, maintaining a clean and hygienic environment

  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, juggling multiple tasks and prioritizing effectively

  • Keen attention to detail, consistently delivering the authentic taste and texture of Sal's Gumbo Shack's dishes

  • Excellent communication skills, collaborating seamlessly with colleagues in a tight-knit team

  • Availability to work evenings, weekends, and holidays, embracing the bustling nature of our restaurant

  • Physical stamina and the ability to stand for extended periods, comfortably lifting items up to 50 pounds

  • A culinary degree or relevant certification is a plus, highlighting your dedication to the craft

    Join Sal's Gumbo Shack and become an integral part of our passionate team, as we continue to delight customers with our beloved gumbo and soulful cuisine. We offer competitive compensation, a vibrant work environment, and ample opportunities for growth within our esteemed restaurant. We appreciate all applicants, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

job.title: Sporting Goods Event Associate (part-time) - $15.00-$20.00/hr
job.description:
Essentials to know:

  • Part-time job; 4 hour shifts on several weekends

  • Hiring multiple individuals - looking for candidates with a background in sports

  • Should have understanding of e-commerce sales, such as taking photos of inventory for sale

What you'll do:

SidelineSwap is the #1 online marketplace in sports. Since we launched in 2015, more than a million athletes have joined our community to buy and sell their gear

We partner with leading sporting goods retailers, like Dick's Sporting Goods, to host trade-in events where customers get paid instantly for their gently used gear. We are looking for help at these events. You will help check-in customers at the event and take pictures of sports equipment we buy. Learn more about our trade-in events at sidelineswap.com/events

Schedule & location:

  • 4 hour shift

  • Day shift, weekend availability

  • Location varies; will be at a local sporting goods retailers throughout the region

Pay: $15.00 - $20.00 per hour

job.title: Lead Line Cook - $20.00-$21.00/hr
job.description:
Come join the largest delivery-first restaurant group in the United States! 

Salted Restaurant Group specializes in delivering better-for-you versions of your favorite foods using delicious, 100% gluten-free ingredients! 

Pay Rate - $20-21 HR
Location- 500 Cortlandt St, Belleville, NJ 07109

Lead Line Cook Responsibilities

  • Prepare food items consistently and in compliance with recipes, portioning, cooking and waste control guidelines

  • Assist in the training and development of staff members

  • Take ownership of the opening, closing, and shift hand-off process 

  • Comply with sanitation regulations and safety standards

  • Communicate customer order information to our virtual FOH team

Requirements

  • A leader who demonstrates initiative and leads by example.

  • Minimum of 2 years of kitchen experience

  • Minimum of 1 year of leadership experience

  • Advanced kitchen skills, including knife/prep work, sautée, and more.

  • Can stand for extended periods of time and lift up to 50 lbs

Benefits 

  • Medical, Dental, & Vision plan

  • 401k with 4% employer match

  • Free, nutritious meals each shift

  • Career advancement opportunities

  • Paid Sick Time

Responsibilities and tasks outlined in this document are not exhaustive and may change as determined by the needs of the company.

job.title: Line Cook - Evenings - $18.00/hr
job.description:
Come join the largest delivery-first restaurant group in the United States! 

Salted Restaurant Group specializes in delivering better-for-you versions of your favorite foods using delicious, 100% gluten-free ingredients! 

Full Time Line Cook | Evening Shift
Shift: Monday - Friday (5 pm - 11 pm)
Address: 921 W Commerce St, Dallas, TX 75208
Pay rate: $18 HR

Responsibilities 

  • Prepare & cook food items consistently and in compliance with recipes, portioning, cooking, and waste control guidelines.

  • Maintain cleanliness and comply with food sanitation requirements by properly handling food and ensuring correct storage.

  • Communicate customer order information to our virtual FOH team.

Requirements

  • Minimum of 6 months of kitchen experience.

  • Good foundation in kitchen skills, including knife/prep work, sauté, and more.

  • Can stand for extended periods of time and lift up to 50 lbs.

Benefits 

  • Medical, Dental, & Vision plan

  • 401k with 4% employer match

  • Free, nutritious meals each shift

  • Career advancement opportunities

  • Paid Sick Time

Responsibilities and tasks outlined in this document are not exhaustive and may change as determined by the needs of the company.

job.description:

Salted Restaurant Group specializes in delivering better-for-you versions of your favorite foods using delicious, 100% gluten-free ingredients! 

Part-Time Line Cook | Weekend Warrior!

job.title: Caregiver for kids - Palo Alto - $20.00-$30.00/hr
job.description:
Otter is a platform that connects parents needing childcare with qualified sitters in their local community. We ensure that all sitters are thoroughly assessed, background checked, and reference checked, giving parents peace of mind. Sitters have the flexibility to choose their own hours and are notified whenever there is a childcare request in their area.

Gig Summary:

  • Pay: $20.00 - $30.00 per hour

  • Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Temporary

  • Expected total hours: Varies based on availability

  • Schedule: Flexible, with 4-hour shifts, 8-hour shifts, day shifts, evening shifts, on-call availability, and weekend availability.

Apply only if you:

  • Have at least 1 year of childcare experience

  • Can provide references that will be able to speak in detail regarding your childcare experience

  • Are reliable, responsible, and punctual for care sessions

  • Can easily adapt to different family expectations

Gig Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule to choose your own hours

  • Opportunities to earn additional income alongside existing jobs

Please note that the responsibilities and tasks outlined in this document are not exhaustive and may change as determined by Otter.

job.title: Retail Supervisor (3 years of experience)
job.description:
Essentials to know:

  • Minimum of 3 years retail experience required

  • Women-led, sustainability-first company

  • Full-time, hourly; available to work up to 40 hours per week

  • Act as brand ambassador - embody brand values, engage customers on the brand, be knowledgeable in all aspects of this conversation

What you’ll bring:

  • Minimum of 3 years Retail Experience required.

  • Positive attitude and feels there is no task too small and no task too large

  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact effectively with diverse personalities

  • Available to work a minimum of 30 hours per week, but up to 40 hours per week

  • Daily open availability across a full 7 day work week

  • Able to work flexible schedule (days, nights, weekends, & holidays if required to meet the needs of the business)

Benefits & Perks:

  • Health, vision, and dental insurance for eligible employees

  • Paid vacation, sick, holidays & volunteer time-off for eligible employees

  • Mission based company + casual and entrepreneurial work environment

  • 401K with company match

  • Clothing discount

How you'll impact the business:

  • Actively lead by example and inspire others to generate clientele and maximize customer retention through engagement and sustained relationships

  • Lead the sales floor to deliver an excellent customer experience through a customer first mindset to build loyal customer relationships

  • Onboard new hires while providing in the moment coaching to improve performance of existing associates

  • Uphold consistent inventory accuracy and controls in store through regular cycle counts and overseeing inbound and outbound inventory. Track receiving and removal of products.

  • Consistently meet and exceed sales goals

job.title: Sales Associate, part-time - $17.00/hr
job.description:
Essentials to know:

  • Part-time, hourly; work a minimum of 20 hours per week

  • Women-led, sustainability-first company

  • Have 1 year experience working with a sales or retail organization

  • Looking for individuals who embody the Reformation brand and its focus on customers and sustainability

What you’ll bring:

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced setting.

  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact effectively with diverse personalities 

  • Driven approach to take on new challenges with the self-motivation for your work and career 

  • Available to work a minimum of 20 hours per week

  • Available to work a minimum of 3 days per week, weekends included

  • Able to work flexible schedule (days, nights, weekends, & holidays if required to meet the needs of the business)

How you'll impact the business:

  • Consistently meet and exceed sales goals.

  • Contribute to an in-store experience for customers that both surprises and delights them. 

  • Deliver and foster a culture of an excellent client experience through a customer first mindset to build long term loyal client relationships.

  • Deliver an elevated client experience acting as a brand ambassador - embody brand values, engage customers on the brand and share the stories of Reformation with a focus on educating on sustainability. 

  • Maintain extraordinary customer experience feedback and scoring on service evaluation through NPS.

job.title: Warehouse Supervisor (3+ years of experience)
job.description:
Essentials to know:

  • Full-time, salaried (est. $60k - $70k/year)

  • 3+ years of relevant experience in a fast-paced, fulfillment environment required

  • You'll lead and motivate 50+ reports ensuring all orders, returns, and receipts are fulfilled within SLA 

  • Working knowledge of Excel to merge and analyze information from separate sources. Experience with VLOOKUP and Pivot Tables is a must.

  • Bilingual in English and Spanish a plus

What You’ll Need: 

  • High School Diploma, or equivalent 

  • 3+ years of relevant experience in a fast-paced, fulfillment environment required

  • Flexible, punctual, and reliable. Able to work 10-hour shifts and weekends

  • Knowledge of Lean, JIT, and 5S principles a plus

  • Working knowledge of Excel to merge and analyze information from separate sources. Experience with VLOOKUP and Pivot Tables is a must.

  • Highly effective written and verbal communication skills

  • Experience with Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) and Computers

  • Ability to bend, lift, open, and move product up to 40 lbs

  • Bilingual in English and Spanish a plus

What You’ll Do:  

  • Lead and motivate 50+ reports ensuring all orders, returns, and receipts are fulfilled within SLA 

  • Hourly tracking and reporting of department KPIs to ensure the highest level of production

  • Monitor associates’ attendance, behavior, and metrics. Providing coaching according to Refs policies and procedures

  • Review backlogs and incoming volumes to create floor plans for department labor

  • Provide detailed end-of-shift reporting bridging any missed production goals

  • Stress and instill the importance of quality within the Distribution Center.

  • Partner with CI engineers to seek operational improvements. Design and implement new warehouse management tools and processes to improve productivity and accuracy

  • Partner with the People team and staffing agencies to recruit and develop team members

  • Uphold and support all OSHA regulations and safety programs to ensure a safe work environment for all associates

Benefits & Perks:

  • Health, vision, and dental insurance for eligible employees

  • Paid sick and holidays & volunteer time-off for eligible employees

  • Mission-based company + casual and entrepreneurial work environment

job.title: Inventory Supervisor, 2nd Shift (3+ years of experience)
job.description:
Essentials to know:

  • Full-time, salaried (est. $65k - $75k/year)

  • Willing to work from 3 pm to 11:30 pm

  • 3+ years of experience as an Inventory Supervisor or similar role is required

  • Responsible for managing and monitoring inventory levels, conducting regular audits, and ensuring accurate records are maintained

  • Experience with Warehouse Management Systems (WMS), Google Sheets, and/or MS Excel is a must

  • Bilingual in English and Spanish a plus

What You’ll Need: 

  • Flexible, punctual, and reliable. Willing to work from 3 pm to 11:30 pm

  • Bilingual in English and Spanish a plus

  • High School Diploma or Equivalent

  • 3+ years of experience as an Inventory Supervisor or similar role is required

  • Strong working knowledge of Google Sheets and MS Excel is a must

  • Experience with Warehouse Management Systems (WMS)and Computers

  • Analytical thinker; able to solve problems quickly and effectively

  • Highly effective written and verbal communication skills

  • Ability to stand for long periods and bend, lift, and move product up to 30 lbs

  • Great organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks

What You’ll Do:  

  • Lead and motivate a team of associates to ensure efficient and accurate inventory management

  • Monitor and analyze inventory performance metrics, such as fill rates and accuracy, and take corrective actions as needed

  • Investigate and resolve inventory discrepancies and communicate findings with management

  • Perform and manage cycle counts to ensure inventory and location accuracy

  • Help and/or assign team members to locate missing items to fulfill orders

  • Utilize warehouse management systems (WMS) to track and manage inventory transactions

  • Identify opportunities to optimize processes and functionality of warehouse management systems

  • Train new staff on inventory management processes and procedures

  • Maintain accurate supply levels to meet customer demand

  • Establish and implement inventory management procedures and drive process standardization

  • Provide on-the-spot coaching according to Ref policies and procedures

  • Uphold all OSHA regulations and safety programs to ensure a safe work environment

Benefits & Perks:

  • Health, vision, and dental insurance for eligible employees

  • Paid sick and holidays & volunteer time-off for eligible employees

  • Mission-based company + casual and entrepreneurial work environment

  • 401K with company match

job.title: Barista - $16.04/hr
job.description:
Lokal is a delicious sandwich shop that's hiring an exceptional barista to join our team.

Gig Summary: 

  • $16.04

  • Tips

  • Part-time

Apply only if you:

  • Have at least 1 year of barista experience

Gig responsibilities: 

  • Make and serve Lokal beverages using different brewing and prep methods.

  • Prep and serve Lokal food following our set of guidelines and in a timely manner. 

  • Be kind and thoughtful towards our guests, your teammates, and all of our vendors and suppliers. 

  • Maintain a clean workstation that meets the quality standards of both Lokal and local guidelines. 

  • Support your team by taking on tasks that keep the cafe running smoothly and looking good including: cleaning, clearing and washing dishes, sweeping, dusting, mopping, cleaning and organizing condiment stations, and taking out trash

  • Uphold and follow all health, food safety, and safety guidelines

  • Promote a safe and respectful working environment

Gig requirements: 

  • Must have an active Food Handler’s Certificate at all times. If you don’t have one now, you can get one once you have landed the gig. 

  • Must be customer-oriented

  • Must be good at multitasking 

Gig benefits: 

  • Unlimited coffee

  • Daily snacks and meals

Responsibilities and tasks outlined in this document are not exhaustive and may change as determined by Lokal.

job.title: Cook/Sandwich maker - $17.00-$18.00/hr
job.description:
Lokal is looking for a detail-oriented line cook to join our back of house staff. You will be responsible for making and assembling our famous sandwiches.

Gig Summary: 

  • $17-$18

  • Part-time

Apply only if you:

  • Have at least 1 year of kitchen experience 

Gig responsibilities: 

  • Prepare high-quality food items according to standardized recipes and instructions to meet production, delivery and service schedules.

  • Serve meals or prepare for delivery by using correct portioning, meeting outlined standards, ensuring that food is at the correct temperature and is attractive and tasty. Tastes all prepared food items.

  • Use established ticket collection procedures during service. Responsible for records from area worked during service periods.

  • Clean the kitchen after preparation and serving, maintaining high standards of cleanliness. 

  • Store or discard excess food in accordance with safe food-handling procedures.

  • Operate and maintain kitchen equipment as instructed.

  • Assist in production planning, record keeping and reporting as required.

  • Assist in the ordering and receiving of all food and supplies as required.

  • Report needed maintenance, faulty equipment or accidents to the supervisor immediately.

  • Attend in-service and safety meetings.

  • Maintain good working relationships with coworkers, customers, administrators and managers.

  • Perform the job safely while maintaining a clean, safe work environment.

  • Perform other duties as assigned.

  • Must be able to stand for extended periods of time and lift up to 50 lbs.

Gig benefits: 

  • Free meals every shift

Responsibilities and tasks outlined in this document are not exhaustive and may change as determined by Lokal.

job.title: Tutor (Manhattan Beach): $20-$25/hr, part-time
job.description:
Key qualifications:

  • At least 1 year of college or junior college

  • Comfortable tutoring Algebra 1

  • Available for a minimum of 10 hours per week between 3pm and 9pm, Monday through Thursday

Locations:

Looking for tutors across El Segundo, Manhattan Beach, Hermosa Beach, Redondo Union, Redondo Beach, Palos Verdes, and Lunada Bay.

About Study Hut:

Our tutoring centers are geared toward having a comfortable, relaxed environment in which students receive individual attention. Our approach is unique in that we cater to the specific needs of the local community, and we provide an environment that is casual, fun, and cool.

What to expect:

  • Students range from elementary school to high school, and we tutor all subjects as well as the SAT, ACT, and other standardized tests

  • Provide personalized support and guidance to students.

  • Clarify complex concepts, assist with problem-solving, and reinforce learning.

  • Adapt teaching methods to cater to individual student needs, promoting confidence and academic growth.

job.title: Tutor (Palos Verdes): $20-$25/hr, part-time
job.description:

  • At least 1 year of college or junior college

  • Comfortable tutoring Algebra 1

  • Available for a minimum of 10 hours per week between 3pm and 9pm, Monday through Thursday

Locations:

Looking for tutors across El Segundo, Manhattan Beach, Hermosa Beach, Redondo Union, Redondo Beach, Palos Verdes, and Lunada Bay.

About Study Hut:

Our tutoring centers are geared toward having a comfortable, relaxed environment in which students receive individual attention. Our approach is unique in that we cater to the specific needs of the local community, and we provide an environment that is casual, fun, and cool.

job.title: Cashier - $16.04/hr
job.description:
Lokal is looking for a cashier to check out customers and to deliver exceptional customer service.

Gig Summary: 

  • $16.04

  • Tips

  • Part-time

Gig responsibilities: 

  • Process customer purchases accurately and efficiently.

  • Accept various forms of payment and provide correct change.

  • Greet customers in a friendly and professional manner.

  • Answer customer inquiries and resolve any issues or concerns.

  • Maintain a clean and organized checkout area.

  • Collaborate with team members to ensure smooth store operations.

  • Qualifications and Requirements:

Gig skill requirements:

  • Basic math skills and attention to detail.

  • Excellent communication and customer service abilities.

  • Ability to handle cash transactions accurately.

  • Strong multitasking and time management skills.

Gig benefits & perks:

Responsibilities and tasks outlined in this document are not exhaustive and may change as determined by Lokal.

job.title: Delivery Driver - $18.75-$19.75/hr
job.description:
Company Vehicle Provided! No CDL Required!
The approximate hours are 5 am to 3 pm. Shifts range between 8-10+ hours per day and shifts are available 7 days per week.

Apply to this job if you are:

  • Eligible to work in the U.S

  • At least 21 years of age

  • Successfully pass a pre-employment drug test, background check and motor vehicle report

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Safely drive and operate your delivery vehicle at all times.

  • Use handheld device for routing information, customer delivery information.

  • Navigate a variety of routes throughout delivery area.

  • Must be comfortable driving and working in varying weather conditions. Load and unload packages to be delivered

  • Be CUSTOMER OBSESSED!! We strive to deliver packages and smiles to our customers.

  • Perform the following tasks, with or without reasonable accommodation:

  • Lift packages up to 85 lbs.

  • Able to get in and out of van or box truck and walk up and down stairs through your shift

Compensation & Benefits:

  • $19.75/hr for qualified box truck drivers & $18.75/hr for van drivers. Helper positions also available.

  • Paid Training

  • Paid Overtime

  • Health Insurance and Benefits

  • Paid Time Off

IMMEDIATE OPENINGS AVAILABLE!!!
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment regardless of age, national origin, race, color, disability, religious beliefs, or sexual orientation.

Location: 2361 Withers Road Liberty, MO 64068

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $18.75 - $19.75 per hour

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule

  • Health insurance

  • Paid time off

  • Paid training

Day range:

  • Monday to Friday

  • Weekend availability

Shift:

  • 10 hour shift

  • 8 hour shift

  • Day shift

Work Location: In person

SPS Ventures is an Amazon Delivery Service Partner looking for enthusiastic, team players to deliver Amazon packages from Liberty, MO (just north-east of Kansas City). Delivery Associates strive to get every Amazon order to the customer’s door on-time. We offer full and part-time opportunities.

job.title: Server - $16.00/hr
job.description:
Wmz Restaurant Group is hiring a server for our location at 324 Lincoln Blvd. The ideal candidate is motivated, reliable, and customer-focused.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide prompt, friendly, and accurate customer service

  • Take orders and coordinate with the kitchen for timely food delivery

  • Maintain cleanliness and organization of the dining area

  • Upsell menu items and promote specials

  • Handle cash transactions and follow safety guidelines

  • Collaborate with team members to ensure a smooth workflow

Qualifications:

  • Excellent communication skills for customer and team interaction

  • Positive attitude aligned with our values and culture

  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and prioritize tasks

  • Previous high-volume restaurant experience preferred

We welcome your application and look forward to hearing from you.

job.title: Scorekeepers / Event Staff - $18.00/hr
job.description:
Legends Western Spotlight: Jun 27, 28, 29 – Salt Lake City, UT

Legends Lacrosse, a premier youth tournament host and provider, is looking for hourly staff to work score tables.  Duties include filling out score sheets for each game, timing penalties and observing the action on field during your games.  No training or prior experience is necessary.  Expect to arrive on site approximately 6:00am and stay until 5:00pm each event day.  If working event you may be able to work the day prior for set up depending on staff needs.

job.title: Scorekeepers / Event Staff - $18.00/hr
job.description:

job.title: Cook - $18.00-$21.00/hr
job.description:
Gametime energy, lifetime Experience! Come be a part of the hustle!

Are you a team player who loves sports? Do you crave a fun, exciting, work environment? If yes, you belong with BDubs!

Buffalo Wild Wings is a fun-filled, high-energy sports bar that continues to grow with numerous opportunities for team members looking to increase their hustle. Our Cooks are the heart of the house. They bring the community together with tasty food that adheres to recipe guidelines. We are a brand on the rise, and we need people like you to help us grow!

Apply to this job if you have:

  • A current California Food Handler’s certificate or be able to obtain one within 5 days.

  • Open availability

Here is what we are looking for:

We're looking for Cooks who put their heart into every meal, thrive in a high-volume environment, love to cook and have fun doing it. You’ll work with some amazing people, enjoy free meals, cheer for your favorite team, and grow with a company that cares about your future.

If you are reliable and have an awesome attitude, then this is the place for you. What are you waiting for? Click apply.

Pay Range: $18 - $21

Benefits: Paid sick time, medical, dental, vision insurance, 401k with company match, free lunch, retention bonus ($250), referral bonus ($125).

Requirements

  • Must have a current California Food Handler’s certificate or be able to obtain one within 5 days.

  • Open availability

  • Previous food service experience a plus

  • At least 18 years of age

  • Ability to lift up to 30 lbs.

  • Ability to stand 6-8 hours.

  • Ability to withstand cold temperatures.

job.title: Returnmates Delivery Driver - $75.00-$125.00/day
job.description:
Drive when you want. Earn with Returnmates.

  • You’re the boss. Choose when you want to drive.

  • Easy money. Pick up and drop off packages...that simple.

  • Upfront pricing. Know your earnings in advance.

About Returnmates

We are a last-mile delivery logistics company. Our mission is to make returns and pickups as seamless as the purchase. Returnmates empowers you to work on a flexible schedule as an independent contractor. If you are looking for easy and consistent work, sign up as a Returnmates driver today!

job.title: Assistant Restaurant Manager - $21.00-$23.00/hr
job.description:
Wmx Restaurant Group is looking for an Assistant Manager to join our 26-person strong team. We are located at 324 Lincoln Blvd. Our ideal candidate is self-driven, ambitious, and reliable.

Responsibilities

  • Train, coach, and develop employees and team leaders

  • Delegate tasks to team and provide follow-up

  • Hold team accountable for their performance; provide coaching and counseling as needed

  • Ensure team provides fast, friendly, and accurate service

  • Ensure product quality, restaurant cleanliness, maintenance and security standards are met

  • Staff and schedule appropriately to control labor costs

  • Ensure proper cash handling and deposit procedures are followed

  • Ensure appropriate inventory and ordering systems are in place

Qualifications

  • Excellent communication skills to connect effectively with customers and co-workers

  • Possess a positive attitude and ethics which support our values and culture

  • Ability to manage a fast-paced, high-volume, clean, customer-focused restaurant

  • Strong time-management skills; ability to multi-task, prioritize, and organize

We are looking forward to hearing from you.

job.title: Line Cook - $18.00-$21.00/hr
job.description:
Wmx Restaurant Group in Venice, CA is looking for a Line Cook to join our 26 person strong team. We are located at 324 Lincoln Blvd. Our ideal candidate is self-driven, punctual, and engaged.

Responsibilities

  • Set up and stock stations with all necessary supplies

  • Chop vegetables, prepare sauces and other food preparation.

  • Cook menu items in cooperation with the rest of the kitchen staff

  • Clean up station and take care of leftover food

  • Stock inventory

Qualifications

  • Cooking experience or Back of the House experience preferred

  • Able to meet all scheduling commitments

  • Able to anticipate needs of others in the kitchen and proactively work to meet those needs

  • Strong attention to detail

job.title: Line cook ($18/hr + tips)
job.description:
Welder's Grilled Cheese, a popular restaurant in Burbank, is currently seeking an experienced and enthusiastic Line Cook to join our team. As a Line Cook, you will be responsible for ensuring that all menu items are prepared to our high standards of quality and presentation, while working in a fast-paced kitchen environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Prepare and cook menu items according to our recipes and specifications

  • Set up and stock stations with all necessary supplies and ingredients

  • Maintain a clean and sanitary work environment at all times

  • Assist in the development of new menu items and specials

  • Ensure that all food items are properly stored and rotated to maintain freshness

  • Work collaboratively with other kitchen staff to ensure timely preparation and delivery of orders

  • Follow all safety and health regulations and guidelines

  • Perform other duties as assigned by the Chef or management team

Requirements:

  • At least 1 year of experience working in a high-volume kitchen environment as a Line Cook

  • Knowledge of food preparation, presentation, and safety techniques

  • Ability to multitask and work efficiently in a fast-paced environment

  • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

  • Ability to communicate effectively and work collaboratively with other team members

  • Flexible schedule, including weekends and holidays

If you are passionate about food and cooking, and are looking for a challenging and rewarding opportunity in the restaurant industry, we encourage you to apply for this position. We offer competitive compensation, opportunities for career growth, and a fun and dynamic work environment.

job.title: Part-time Line Cook ($18/hr; $500 bonus after 90 days)
job.description:
Come join the largest delivery-first restaurant group in the United States! 

Salted Restaurant Group specializes in delivering better-for-you versions of your favorite foods using delicious, 100% gluten-free ingredients! 

Part- Time Line Cook (24 hrs weekly) 
Pay Rate: $17 - $18 HR

$500 bonus after 90 days!
Location: 1388 Daisy Ave. Long Beach, CA 90813

Responsibilities 

  • Prepare & cook food items consistently and in compliance with recipes, portioning, cooking, and waste control guidelines.

  • Maintain cleanliness and comply with food sanitation requirements by properly handling food and ensuring correct storage.

  • Communicate customer order information to our virtual FOH team.

Requirements

  • Minimum of 6 months of kitchen experience.

  • Good foundation in kitchen skills, including knife/prep work, sauté, and more.

  • Can stand for extended periods of time and lift up to 50 lbs.

Benefits 

  • Free, nutritious meals each shift

  • Career advancement opportunities

Responsibilities and tasks outlined in this document are not exhaustive and may change as determined by the needs of the company.

job.title: Assistant Retail Store Manager (up to $28/hr)
job.description:
Essentials to know:

  • 4+ years retail management experience

  • Women-led, sustainability-first company

  • Full-time, salaried

Overview:

No position at Reformation is about the status quo, every team member is passionate about building a company rooted in excellence. Obsessed with customers and sustainability we use tech to create a unique interaction between our customers, employees, and the Reformation brand. The Assistant Manager will help lead and execute all efforts required to achieve individual store goals.

What You’ll Do:

  • Measure and Monitor sales performance taking action to improve business performance when needed.

  • Consistently meet and exceed store sales goals.

  • Drive the execution of an elevated client experience acting as a brand ambassador - embody brand values, engage customers on the brand and share the stories of Reformation with a focus on educating on sustainability. 

  • Lead the sales floor and deliver an excellent customer experience through a customer first mindset to build loyal client relationships

  • Assist customers and monitor client interaction with the team and technology, provide in the moment coaching for continuous improvement

  • Create an optimal balance of sales and service by having the right people, in the right place at the right time through effective scheduling while achieving payroll goals 

  • Deliver and maintain extraordinary customer experience NPS scores.

  • Uphold consistent inventory accuracy and controls in store.  Lead and train the team in store to ensure consistent deliverables. 

  • Contribute to Loss Prevention in all areas of the business, set expectations and own training for the store team.

  • Assist in ownership of operational execution of store to achieve necessary revenue targets 

  • Ensure facility maintenance, presentation and organization

  • Assist in merchandising presentation and concept standards utilizing retail and product reporting to regularly strategize for the customer experience and productivity of the business.

  • Provide real-time and weekly feedback on product and sales performance to Store Manager to influence allocations and the success of the business.

  • Ensure the selling floor reflects the brand and concept standards at all times, train support staff and develop talent in visual and digital merchandising.

  • Assist in managing the day-to-day performance of the retail teams, enabling progressive career development and an incredible employee experience.

  • Assist in hiring, training and development of the store team across all areas of the business.

  • Uphold consistent inventory accuracy and controls in store.  Lead & train the team in store to ensure consistent deliverables. 

What you’ll bring:

  • Minimum of 4 years Retail Management Experience required. 

  • Experience working with a sales or retail organization and/or operationally intensive business.

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment

  • Ability to set the standard for operational efficiency, adhering to processes and systems to maximize team and business results, and identifying opportunities for improvement

  • The skills to collaborate with cross-functional partners in the pursuit of shared business outcomes

  • A proactive sense of urgency and ability to prioritize important work

  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact effectively with diverse personalities 

  • Driven approach to take on new challenges with the self-motivation for your work and career that inspires others

  • Excellent communicator and team player with a passion for people

  • An effective and expedient problem-solver, strong business acumen with a keen attention to detail

  • Positive attitude and feels there is no task too small and no task too large

Skill Requirements:

  • Available to work a minimum of 40 hours per week

  • Daily open availability across a full 7 day work week

  • Able to work flexible schedule (days, nights, weekends, & holidays if required to meet the needs of the business)

  • Understanding of Retail Labor Laws

  • GSuite experience a plus

  • References required

Benefits & Perks:

  • Health, vision, and dental insurance for eligible employees

  • Paid vacation, sick, holidays & volunteer time-off for eligible employees

  • Mission based company + casual and entrepreneurial work environment

  • 401K with company match 

  • Clothing discount

job.title: Line Cook - $17.00-$20.00/hr
job.description:
Description

We are looking for future leaders who are ready to grow with our brand!

At Tocaya we use bold flavors and the best ingredients to proudly create our signature "Modern Mexican" cuisine. Our versatile menu is rooted in traditional Mexican recipes and naturally accommodates a variety of preferences including vegan, vegetarian, and gluten-free.

Our methods and flavor-focused menu inspire a growing group of loyal guests who join us multiple times a week, eager to introduce the Tocaya experience to their friends as well.

The role as a Line Cook is extremely important to our success. Our Line cooks are responsible for preparing food in a timely manner, maintaining Tocaya’s excellent food quality and presentation, minimizing unnecessary food waste, and maintaining high levels of food safety and food preparation in alignment with the health department national standards. Candidates must have previous kitchen experience, accuracy and speed in executing assigned tasks, and the ability to maintain a clean station while preparing food for service.

Setting the tone:

  • Successful line cooks know the importance of working in a team with positivity and "leaving our baggage at the door."
  • They maintain a positive and professional approach with coworkers and customers
  • Communicates well with others and is a great team player

Kitchen Operations:

  • Set up and stocking stations with all necessary supplies
  • Prepare food for service (e.g. chopping vegetables, butchering meat, or preparing sauces)
  • Cook menu items in cooperation with the rest of the kitchen staff
  • Answer, report and follow Executive or Chef de Cuisine’s instructions
  • Clean up station and take care of leftover food
  • Stock inventory appropriately
  • Ensure that food comes out simultaneously, in high quality and in a timely fashion
  • Comply with nutrition and sanitation regulations and safety standards

Skill:

  • Follows and enforces all company recipes.
  • Prepares a variety of meats, seafood, poultry, vegetables and other food items for cooking in broilers, grills, fryers and a variety of kitchen equipment.
  • Assumes 100% responsibility for quality of products served.
  • Understands and complies consistently with our standard portion sizes, cooking methods, quality standards and kitchen rules, policies and procedures.
  • Stocks and maintains sufficient levels of food products at line stations to assure a smooth service period.
  • Portions food products prior to cooking according to standard portion sizes and recipe specifications.
  • Maintains a clean and sanitary workstation area including tables, shelves, grills, broilers, fryers, sauté burners, flat top range and refrigeration equipment.
  • Prepares items for broiling, grilling, frying, sautéing or other cooking methods by portioning, battering, breading, seasoning and/or marinating.
  • Follows proper plate presentation.

QUALIFICATIONS / REQUIREMENTS

Qualifications:

  • Available to work nights, weekends, and holidays as needed
  • Knowledge of the industry and relevant health and safety regulations.
  • Current Food Handlers card.
  • Accuracy and speed in executing assigned tasks
  • Ability to maintain a clean station while preparing food for service.
  • Previous Kitchen Experience Preferred

Requirements:

  • Must be able to lift up to 35 lbs, and frequently lift and bend from the waist.
  • Must be able to stand for long periods.
  • This position requires frequent use of hands and arms in repetitive motions.
  • Regularly required to handle hot food.
Hourly Rate: 16.25 + Tips

  • Communicate customer order information to our virtual FOH team

  • Can stand for extended periods of time and lift up to 50 lbs

Benefits

job.title: Fashion Inventory Quality Associate - $20/hr
job.description:
Essentials to know:

  • Full-time role

  • 1+ year experience in QA/QC or similar role in apparel

  • Strong eye for detail

  • Estimated $18 - $20/hr

Overview:

The Quality Assurance Auditor performs inspection and testing of all inbound garments and returned merchandise to ensure quality standards and procedures are met. This position is also responsible for conducting vendor audits and evaluations which may take place at the vendor specific locations. 

Responsibilities: 

  • Perform visual inspections of finished products 

  • Participate in internal/external assessments and audits as required 

  • Conduct routine and non-routine audit reports of inbound garments, returned merchandise and finished goods to meet established standards 

  • Receive and inspect returned merchandise 

  • Identify quality issues and recommend solutions 

  • Prepare and write product specification sheets

  • Supply quality data necessary for regulatory submissions, as needed 

  • Travel within Greater Los Angeles area to vendor locations when needed 

Skill Requirements: 

  • Minimum of 1 year experience in Quality Control or similar role in apparel industry

  • High School Diploma 

  • Strong attention to detail

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel

  • Basic mathematical skills: addition, subtraction and multiplication

  • Understanding of garment measuring and construction, ability to read a standard tape measure

  • Bi-lingual English/Spanish preferred

  • Must be willing to work weekends, holidays and/or overtime as needed

Essential Physical Abilities: 

Must be able to lift and carry up to 20 lbs. for short distances. Perform frequent repetitive finger, hand and wrist motions, standing for long periods of time, as well as bending, kneeling, reaching, stooping, squatting, pulling and pushing. Able to travel across a variety of surfaces (stairs, ramps, uneven terrain). 

Work Setting: 

  • Indoors, Environmentally Controlled 

  • Outdoors, Exposed to Weather

job.title: Fashion Technical Designer (4 YoE, est: $60k-$70k/yr)
job.description:
Essentials to know:

  • Full-time, salaried

  • 4-6 years experience in apparel technical design

  • End-to-end ownership from design to production

Overview:

Reformation is looking for an awesome Technical Designer who will link the design department and production to ensure that all designs translate to amazing garments. The role reports directly to the Technical Design Manager and includes supporting your product category(s), leading the fit process from design to production, maintaining fit standards, generating clear detailed fit comments to vendors, supporting the technical design workflow for the category. You will be working closely with our design, product development, and production departments. 

We are looking for a full-time, super-efficient, hard-working, seasoned Technical Designer who will make sure our clothes look and fit great and are made at the highest level of quality standards. 

What You’ll Do:

  • Work closely with design and product development to ensure that designs are translated correctly, keeping size and fit consistent

  • Conduct fittings on a live model, record comments, and communicate with team and partners

  • Analyze garments and patterns to determine compliance of spec, construction, and fit intent

  • Create technical fit comments, advise construction details, and clearly communicate the status and direction of each style to vendors

  • Review production, quality, and cost issues: problem solve and make recommendations that help maintain brand integrity

  • Maintain WIP report and workflow tracking

  • Maintain a working knowledge of appropriate fit aesthetic for the Reformation customer

  • Collaborate with Technical Design Manager to create and carry out new processes to improve product workflow

  • Develop collaborative relationships with cross functional teams

  • Develop partnerships with all vendors helping to create successful relationships

  • Support onboarding and training of assisting staff

What You’ll Need:

  • Degree in Apparel design & manufacturing

  • 4-6 years experience in apparel technical design

  • Extreme attention to detail and accuracy, as well as ability to prioritize and make quick decisions

  • Superior organizational skills and excellent communication skills; team oriented; highly detail oriented and meticulous

  • Thrive in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment

  • Extremely honest and trustworthy with highest integrity

  • Ability to multitask and meet deadlines, balance creativity with technical capability, and interpret design sketches for tech packs

  • Knowledge of garment construction, pattern making, silhouettes, color ways, sewing techniques, fabrication and trim; familiarity with print design and manufacturing

  • Experience working with overseas factories

Who You Are:

  • Very skilled at full package who wants to excel into a better quality apparel collection

  • Desire to grow and continue a career in full package for an established and high growth company

Benefits & Perks:

  • Health, vision, and dental insurance for eligible employees

  • Paid vacation, sick, holidays & volunteer time-off for eligible employees

  • Mission based company + casual and entrepreneurial work environment

  • Clothing discount, dog-friendly office, company events + parties and much more 

  • 401K with company match
